meanings.definition: Something or someone that is not in its correct historical or chronological time period.
meanings.sent1: The knight wearing a wristwatch was an anachronism in the medieval play.
meanings.sent2: The old-fashioned carriage in the modern city was an anachronism.
meanings.sent3: Seeing a dinosaur using a smartphone would be an amusing anachronism.
meanings.sent4: Her love for vinyl records in the age of streaming was an anachronism.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut's antique space suit was a vivid anachronism in the futuristic setting.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that seems to belong to the past rather than the present.
meanings.sent1: The elderly man dressed in Victorian attire was an anachronism at the music festival.
meanings.sent2: The ancient artifact displayed in the museum was an anachronism from a bygone era.
meanings.sent3: The knight riding a unicycle was an amusing anachronism at the jousting tournament.
meanings.sent4: Her typewriter on the sleek desk was a striking anachronism in the modern office.
meanings.sent5: The medieval castle amidst skyscrapers was a memorable anachronism in the cityscape.

meanings.definition: An error in chronology in which a person, object, event, etc., is assigned a date or period other than the correct one.
meanings.sent1: The movie set in the 1800s with a character using a laptop had an anachronism in the storyline.
meanings.sent2: The painting depicting a modern cityscape in a Renaissance art exhibition had an anachronism.
meanings.sent3: The play set in ancient Rome featuring a character with a wristwatch had a comical anachronism.
meanings.sent4: The novel set in the future with references to outdated technology had a metaphorical anachronism.
meanings.sent5: The historical documentary with a misplaced historical figure was a glaring anachronism in the film.
